channel.title: What xstream version do RSC sources need to have?
channel.description: hi, i recently learned that the reason why, when I try to run the server, the server gets an error where there is no constructor is because the xstream it is using is outdated. Now I'm wondering which version works with RSC because I tried 1.4.1 & 1.4.2 and they produce errors that clearly show that it is not meant for this old of a server.

item.title: What xstream version do RSC sources need to have?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:11, topic:534210”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=653007.msg4375839#msg4375839 date=1382041750]

The reason most people haven’t fixed it, that are able to, is because XStream and XML sucks and there are far better alternatives.

[/quote]

[quote author=Vix link=topic=650304.msg4369093#msg4369093 date=1380242969]
I know JSONs all the rage right now but when it comes to reading data on launch its personal preference alone.
[/quote][/quote]I said nothing about using JSON… Also, it’s well established that XML is not intended for things like this.

Read full topic
item.source: What xstream version do RSC sources need to have?

item.title: What xstream version do RSC sources need to have?
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Figured out this on my own and solved it a while back. Anyway, this was the answer:

arham 4:

OT: Update your xstream to the latest version from the website. You must also update/add the new XMLPull and XPP3.

Read full topic

item.title: What xstream version do RSC sources need to have?
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:7, topic:534210”][quote author=waj link=topic=653007.msg4375650#msg4375650 date=1381973465]

If you don’t want to fix the error, use JDK 6.

Terrible solution; update your assets. To fix the no-argument constructor error you need to construct xstream with reflection provider and the driver.

Might not be ideal, the fact of the matter is I gave him a solution to his problem as this type of topic appears on a regular basis and so far I think 2 people in the community have fixed the issue, therefor I doubt he is going to fix it either and just wants to get his server to load.

Most people want things handed out on a plate, I gave him the 2 options, fix it, or use JDK 6. If you want to hand feed him and show him how to fix it, go ahead but its been done countless times and no one has bothered to take the advice or code and fix it.
[/quote]
Only 2 people? You’ve got to be kidding me…

OT: Update your xstream to the latest version from the website. You must also update/add the new XMLPull and XPP3.[/quote]
No I am not joking, do a search in this section for “xstream” the first topic explains how to fix it, yet no one apart from a selected few
has bothered.

Read full topic
item.source: What xstream version do RSC sources need to have?
